Dear [@CAPS1], I'd like to point out that more and more people are spending time on computers rather than with their families. However, I also recognize the many benefits of using computers.  Firstly, computers are a valuable source of information. They provide weather reports, details about school openings, delays, and closings. As more and more people use computers, I believe it does not benefit society. There are several reasons for this. When people sit on the computer for long periods, playing games or chatting, they are not exercising. More than [@PERCENT2] of obese people claim they don't exercise because they are either too tired or don't have enough time. However, if they spend hours sitting in front of a computer screen, it's no wonder they are tired. And the time they spend on the computer could be used for physical activity. Although plants can help protect the [@CAPS1] layer, the demand for paper when printing from computers makes it difficult to maintain a balance. I understand that computers can be useful for quick information searches, but there are also books available. People should stop being lazy and get active. By reducing computer use, we can put a stop to suicides caused by online bullying, combat obesity, and protect the environment. In conclusion, the over - use of computers is causing more harm than good to society.

Spending quality time with family is of utmost importance. One can visit cousins on weekends or host family parties. Although the computer can be used to communicate with distant relatives, taking a vacation to visit them in person can strengthen family bonds. I am writing to the local newspaper to discuss the effects of computers on people. In my opinion, computers do have a significant impact on individuals. Sitting in front of the computer makes people feel so relaxed that they don't want to get up and exercise. This lack of exercise can then lead to unhealthy eating habits. People may reach for junk food like chips, donuts, and twinkies.  I once saw a commercial that stated that people who are more active are healthier than those who stay on the computer all day. In fact, most people who spend a lot of time on the computer gain weight because they are not physically active. This inactivity can lead to various health problems such as obesity, clogged arteries, and laziness.  Instead of being glued to the computer, people should enjoy nature and engage in physical activities like playing sports. Not only is sports fun, but it is also beneficial for health. The choice is between living a healthy and active life or a sedentary and potentially unhealthy one. There are weight - loss surgeries, but they are expensive and can have serious side effects, including death.  In conclusion, it is up to the people in our community to make the right choice. Computers are a valuable asset to society, offering several benefits.  Firstly, they enable communication with friends and family. One can chat with friends at any time, regardless of distance. They allow us to see reviews and comments about products. If someone bought a product that didn't work, we can read about it and avoid making the same mistake. We can also gauge the popularity of a product based on the majority's opinion. Additionally, computers can make us think about things we might not have considered before. For instance, if we have a negative view about something, reading online content can show us what we did wrong or what we missed. They can inform us about schedule changes, such as closures, delays, or openings. We don't have to wait for the news to learn about local crimes or what's happening in our town. They tell us about new developments in our community, like new businesses or upcoming projects.  In conclusion, computers are extremely useful as they allow us to chat with loved ones, offer fresh perspectives, and keep us informed about the latest events. Their benefits make them an important part of our daily lives.

The invention of computers was a significant step forward in human discovery. Regrettably, the negative impacts of this remarkable invention overshadow its novelty. The advent of computers has brought about a lack of physical activity and a diminished interest in, or even an inability to appreciate, nature. In addition to the detrimental effects on the mind, computers are also a major cause of the deterioration of relationships. After all, who has time for friends and family when engrossed in an online game? Despite their unique and fascinating nature, computers are gradually eroding the human mind. An increased focus on the computer screen often leads to a decreased concern for physical exercise and a reduction in the amount of daily physical activity. While using the computer, the mind may be active, but the body remains stationary, with little to no physical movement. For some individuals, the addiction is so severe that they only move to eat, use the restroom, go to bed, or when compelled by their parents. All the food consumed throughout the day accumulates in the stomach, and very little of it is burned off. In some extreme cases, individuals are so absorbed in the computer that they stay up late, sacrificing essential sleep. Sleep is crucial for both the body and the mind, and sleep deprivation can be harmful. Nowadays, computers are depriving people of the sleep and exercise their bodies need. The emergence of computers has also had a negative impact on our appreciation of nature. Fewer people are going outside to admire its beauty. Nature is a great teacher, offering insights into the circle of life and the natural order of the world. Often, we can draw parallels between the wild and the domesticated. However, because people are so attached to their computers, they are unable to fully experience the world. Some argue that we can find information about flora and fauna online, but looking at a picture is not the same as being in the presence of the actual plant or animal, where we can study it from all angles. The experience of being in nature is far more enriching than viewing it through a screen. Moreover, computers are typically used indoors, blocking our view of the real world. Even with laptops, when taken outside, users are more likely to focus on the screen rather than their surroundings. Computers have significantly reduced our appreciation of nature. Relationships with family and friends also suffer when computers are involved. Many people pay little attention to conversations while using the computer. They often pretend to listen, but their minds are elsewhere. Even when chatting with friends online, the conversation is often fragmented because their attention is divided between the chat and other online activities. In face - to - face conversations without a computer, people's minds may still be preoccupied with something they saw on the computer earlier. Clearly, relationships are being strained, and computers are to blame. Computers are gradually consuming society. Much of the information we can find on computers, such as the study of distant places, can also be found in books. Computers have led to a lack of exercise, less time spent in nature, strained relationships, and an overall unhealthy lifestyle. In return, they have contributed very little to society. Why does the world continue to tolerate the negative effects of computers on humanity?

It is more harmful than traditional bullying, like demanding lunch money, because once words are posted online, they can never be fully retracted. False information isn't only an issue in research; people can also pretend to be someone else in anonymous chat - rooms and instant messaging, making them dangerous and unreliable.  In conclusion, the internet has stronger negative impacts and consequences than positive ones. Cyber - bullying, scamming, and misinformation are all negative factors that outweigh the positives.

However, computers represent a significant advancement in modern science and bring benefits to communities.  Computers have significantly contributed to education, both at school and at home. One can hardly imagine the trouble of coming home with an assignment or having to write two essays by hand. The urge to finish quickly might lead to hasty work and a poor grade. Additionally, handwriting can be an issue. Many students have poor handwriting, making it difficult for teachers to grade their work. With programs like an organization's software, users can choose from various fonts, colors, bolding options, add pictures, symbols, etc.  In schools, computers are increasingly being used by teachers to aid learning. Students take tests on computers, visit websites for research, and use programs like PowerPoint for projects. Computers not only assist in schoolwork but also enable students to learn more effectively.  Computers also play a vital role in keeping in touch with friends and family. The era of short letters has been replaced by long emails with attached pictures, which can be sent in seconds via the internet and appear on the recipient's screen. People can save money by storing pictures on their computers instead of having them developed. Communication through computers has advanced significantly. Features such as video chat (vchat), where one can see and talk to the other person, or audio chat, have made it easier to connect. These convenient communication methods encourage people to stay in touch with their loved ones.  Computers also offer a wealth of entertainment on the web. There are websites where one can play games, reconnect with old acquaintances, or watch funny videos. Typing a query into the toolbar instantly provides a page of links to relevant websites. For example, YouTube allows people to upload videos, offering endless possibilities. Another popular website is a particular one where users can 'friend' people from the past, post videos, and write messages.  In conclusion, it is time to recognize the full benefits of computers. They are beneficial to modern society as they support education, promote communication with family and friends, and offer entertainment. We should acknowledge that computers are a major scientific advancement, a great help, and a source of fun.

The impact of computers on humans is undoubtedly positive. The remarkable intelligence they offer should be embraced rather than feared and avoided. Whether we accept it or not, computers will be essential for solving future problems. Moreover, for personal use, computers are highly beneficial.  The main reason people fear computers is the perceived danger of their radiation, which is not reasonable upon closer examination. Not using such a sophisticated and developed system as the computer is completely irrational. The computer is the future, plain and simple. It is inevitable that computers and related technologies will shape the future of our world.  Computers can play a crucial role in solving global problems. They can predict natural disasters, allowing people in the affected areas to be evacuated and potentially saving lives. They can calculate pollution margins and provide solutions to reduce the large amount of pollution released by humans into the air and other environments, thus sparing nature. Making full use of computers can achieve so much more. People must adapt to this technology; otherwise, we will fall behind and witness the deterioration of our environment. This demonstrates that the impact of computers on people is not only positive but also necessary for progress in an ever - evolving world.  On a more personal level, computers also bring benefits. In most cases, computers perform better and make fewer errors than humans. Instead of sending humans to dangerous locations like deep water, computers can be deployed to explore previously inaccessible areas. Faster communication is also extremely useful in certain situations. For example, in a workplace where an area becomes off - limits, an employee can simply email their employer, providing accurate information and avoiding putting themselves in danger or the hassle of a commute. Even across long distances, with just a click, people around the world can be informed of an accident. Foreign communication, especially through instant messaging, can strengthen our ties with other nations in both business and government.  Finding information is incredibly easy with a computer. Without computers, we would still have to go to the library, check out books, and read through numerous pages to find information that could be retrieved in less than a minute on a computer. Even those who are skeptical about computers have to admit their high utility.  Some people, especially parents, have concerns about the safety and reliability of computers. However, these concerns can be easily addressed. By installing one of the many available programs that allow access to 'good' websites and block 'bad' or potentially dangerous ones, the risks associated with online interactions can be eliminated. In fact, computers are generally safe. Only a small fraction of websites contain content considered 'detrimental' to humans, and a large proportion of websites provide reliable and correct information. These statistics dispel the doubts about the safety and reliability of computers.  In conclusion, the positive influence of computers on users far outweighs the negative aspects. Computers are the future and have even proven to save lives. The benefits of personal computers are too significant to ignore. When carefully evaluated, computers are reliable and can be made extremely safe, eliminating the main concerns. We have come a long way in developing such a beneficial and necessary device, and we should put it to good use to improve our own lives and the lives of others.

Dear Local Newspaper: The question of whether computers positively affect society is an important one. As technology progresses, humans are relying on computers more and more, with most people using them daily. I firmly believe that computers have a positive impact on people as they assist with writing papers, serve as a social tool, and simplify research. After reading this letter, there should be no doubt about the positive influence of computers on society.  Firstly, computers are extremely helpful in writing papers. Whether it's a resume, a science report, or a spreadsheet, these are rarely written by hand nowadays. Everyone expects to see neatly typed letters on printer paper. Writing a paper often requires multiple drafts to make it perfect, and it's very cumbersome to write each draft by hand. Moreover, typed text is easier to read, especially when the writer has poor handwriting.  Secondly, computers act as a powerful social tool. Many online websites, such as YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, and MySpace, have social networks. On these and other sites, people can meet others through friends and games. The advantage of meeting people online is that there's no need to schedule a meeting time. As long as both parties are online, they can start chatting. This is particularly useful for long - distance relationships, whether it's with friends, partners, or family. Online chatting helps people stay in touch with those they may not see every day, which is a great boost to everyone's social life. Online dating sites like eHarmony or Match.com also help people with busy schedules find their perfect partners. This is beneficial for shy people who want to get married and start a family, leading to happier lives.  Finally, computers make research much easier. My dad often says, "You kids got it easy. When I was growing up, we had to go to the library and spend hours researching before we could write our papers." Nowadays, it's simple. Using the internet and a search engine, you just need to type a topic, and you can get all the latest articles in seconds. Libraries may not have the most recent books, or the book on your topic may be checked out. The internet is especially useful for very specific research topics, such as a certain bacteria or species that a book may only briefly mention. With the internet having a wider range of articles, it's much easier to find information on any topic. This means people can spend more time enjoying their day, like playing outside, instead of stressing in the library because they can't find a relevant book.  In conclusion, computers have a positive impact on society. They assist with writing papers, serve as a social tool, and simplify research. Imagine if we had to handwrite everything, how many fewer friends and relationships we would have without social websites, and how difficult research would be without the internet. Computers have improved our lives, and we should be grateful for all they do.

Computers have a significant impact on society, but are they truly beneficial in every aspect? People tend to spend an excessive amount of time on computers. Additionally, many people on Facebook lie about their identities, and in today's digital age, it is easy for hackers to access personal information. In conclusion, computers do not help the brain, can cause weight gain, and create a lot of drama. Therefore, people should limit their computer use.

A large number of people use computers daily for various purposes. Despite some individuals spending excessive time on computers, the overall benefits they bring to society are undeniable. Without computers, society would not function as efficiently as it does currently. One of the key benefits of computers is their ability to complete tasks such as writing papers and researching information much more quickly. For instance, if an organization needed to print an article about a devastating earthquake in a specific location, computers would be invaluable as they allow for faster typing compared to handwriting. In conclusion, when used in balance with other important activities such as exercise and socializing, computers are highly beneficial to society. They offer quick and efficient task - completion, help maintain relationships, and provide access to knowledge. Society would be less efficient and more isolated without the use of computers.

It exposes us to danger, makes us less intelligent, and turns us into lazy individuals. Therefore, we should limit our time on the computer to avoid these problems.

Finally, less time is spent with friends and family, which is the most important aspect. Family is our closest support system, and friends bring joy and support into our lives. I would like to address the question of whether computers have a positive or negative impact on our lives. Despite their relatively short existence, the debate over their effects is highly controversial. While computers do aid in research, I firmly believe that they are not a necessity and can be quite harmful.  Firstly, people spend an excessive amount of time on computers. After using a computer for an hour or an hour - and - a - half, negative effects start to emerge. One may experience eye strain and headaches, which can become so severe that it feels like one's head is on fire. This occurs because the brain struggles to process the brightness of the screen along with the information being read. Many people end up taking breaks in a dark room but then return to the computer, repeating the cycle. Clearly, computers act as an obstacle to our normal lives.  Secondly, computer use leads to a lack of exercise. After long hours on the computer, people only have time for basic activities like eating, sleeping, and going to work or school. This sedentary lifestyle deprives them of outdoor activities, increasing the risk of obesity. Obesity, in turn, brings about various health problems, such as reduced physical strength, limited mobility, and for children, stunted growth. It also shortens life expectancy.  Finally, computers are harmful to the environment. With billions of people using electronic devices globally, the heat generated by computers contributes to the depletion of the ozone layer and global warming. The heat from computer fans creates holes in the ozone layer, which is crucial for protecting us from the sun's ultraviolet rays. If this trend continues, it will have catastrophic consequences for our planet.  In conclusion, computers, despite their useful features, are a nuisance to our society. We need to be more aware of their negative impacts and take appropriate measures to reduce their overuse.

On the negative side, computers can be misused as a form of childcare. When children are on the computer, they sit idle, staring at a screen filled with words and pictures. Some parents use the computer to keep their kids quiet instead of taking them outdoors. Growing up in such an environment, children may only know how to play computer games and talk to friends online. Kids have abundant energy and need to engage in productive activities to stay fit and healthy. Using the computer as a babysitter can lead to childhood obesity as children neglect proper physical care.  On the positive side, computers offer the opportunity to learn about far - off places and people. For example, if a teacher assigns a last - minute essay on @LOCATION2 due in a week, traveling to @LOCATION2 to gather information is both time - consuming and expensive. And if the library lacks relevant books, the computer can provide endless information, allowing one to finish the essay quickly. If someone is planning to visit @LOCATION4 but knows nothing about it, researching online can reveal local traditions, clothing styles, etc. Also, learning about long - gone famous people is easy with the help of the computer.  Finally, computers facilitate online communication. Suppose your grandma lives in @LOCATION3, and long - distance calls are costly. Using the computer to talk online can save money. For instance, my grandparents live in @LOCATION1. After they got a computer, we bought webcams and started chatting on @ORGANIZATION1 every day, which not only allowed us to talk but also see each other. If a friend doesn't have a phone and you need to ask about homework, you can find them on social media.  In conclusion, despite the negative effects on children, computers have more positive impacts as they help people learn about distant places and people and enable online communication.

Dear Newspaper, I think computers have a considerable impact on people. When people are using computers, they mainly exercise their fingers and don't get the physical exercise they need. Staring at the computer screen all the time is also harmful to one's health.  Another aspect is diet. People using computers often eat junk food in a hurry so that they can get back to the computer. They don't consume the nutritious food they should.   All these factors affect people's lives. They may not go out as much as they should, which can have a negative impact on their overall well - being. In conclusion, the over - use of computers can lead to a sedentary lifestyle and poor eating habits, which are detrimental to people's health.

Regarding the idea of spending more time in nature, what if one encounters a wild animal or gets lost? In such situations, the knowledge available on @ORGANIZATION1 can be a lifesaver. Dear Newspaper, I firmly believe that computers are among the best inventions of all time. They enable communication with individuals in distant locations, assist in exploring career and educational options, and offer learning opportunities across a wide range of subjects. Computers are here to benefit society, not cause harm, so there is no reason not to use them. With computers, we can communicate with people around the world or even in space. In fact, all global communications rely on satellites, which orbit the planet from space. Professor @PERSON1 at @ORGANIZATION1 informed students at @ORGANIZATION3 that many everyday items, such as cars and phones, utilize computer technology. Computers facilitate human communication. Additionally, they aid millions of people in making educational and career choices. Most college - bound students have limited knowledge of the numerous colleges available. When my sister was choosing a college, she was initially unsure. She sat down and researched hundreds of schools. After narrowing down her options, she selected @ORGANIZATION4, a college she had never heard of just a couple of months prior. Similar situations are common. At @ORGANIZATION2, a survey was conducted among students to determine their career aspirations. Over the following week, students got to experience different career options, and @PERCENT1 of them chose a different career path. The saying “Knowledge is power” holds true, and computers are an excellent source of knowledge. They cover various subjects, including math, science, history, and language. People should make use of this knowledge. At the @CAPS4 Francisco National Debate, @PERSON2 stated that “Computers are a great tool when used properly, whether for researching new places, studying math, or communicating. They should not be used mainly for unhealthy games.” In the @NUM1 grade, my teacher assigned a report on a country. My friend and I discovered a place we had never heard of before. Using the computer, we found a wealth of information about it, such as its main income sources, exports, resorts, and fun activities. After considering these facts, it is evident that computers are a valuable tool that should be utilized. They enable communication, support educational decision - making, and provide access to a vast amount of knowledge. I strongly advocate for everyone to use computers.

Even though that's what teachers are for, they're not always available, like when I'm at home or on vacation and I want to review math. It also helps people learn new languages like @CAPS2, @CAPS3, and @CAPS4. Two days ago, I had a video chat with my grandparents in @LOCATION2. It was amazing. After six years of not seeing them, they'd really changed, and I was starting to forget what they looked like. I was surprised that a computer could do a video chat from so far away. Some people, like those in the army, love video chatting because it allows them to see their loved ones. Dear @ORGANIZATION1, I am of the opinion that computers are a valuable technological resource. There are several reasons to support this view. Firstly, children spend more than half of the school day in school. How can they be constantly on the computer when they are engaged in learning at school? In school, they get plenty of exercise as they are always on the move. After school, kids usually do their homework or go out with friends. Computers do not have a negative impact on people; instead, they make people smarter. Secondly, if children have access to a computer at home, parents should regulate the time they spend on it and what they do. Supporters of technological advancements are correct in stating that computers stimulate imagination and learning. Parents of children with computers should be more vigilant. If they are concerned, they can take the computer away. They should also take their kids out more often so that the children do not rely solely on the internet. Lastly, computers serve as a means of communication. If one does not have a phone, they can use a computer to access email or personal websites. Moreover, people need computers for schoolwork and their jobs. Many people also use computers for research and writing reports. We need access to information. In conclusion, my views are worthy of consideration. Many others might be too shy to voice these opinions and get them published in the local newspaper. I firmly believe that computers do not interfere with our relationships with family, friends, or nature. As a society, we rely on computers for our daily activities. Without the ability to go online or save files, we would be at a loss. I urge you to take my ideas into account. Thank you.

Dear @CAPS1, I believe that technological advancements can be harmful to society for several reasons. Firstly, they open the door to strangers for teens, adults, and others. The problem is that you never truly know who is on the other side of that virtual door. In chat rooms, people can mislead you into thinking they are someone they are not. For example, there is a show called Dateline. This show depicts how young teens put themselves online. Grown or young men click on their pictures, opening a chat line. You have no idea who is on the other end. These men online make the teens trust them and feel safe. They might ask, “Hey, can I come over sometime?” The young teen, thinking they are a friend, often agrees. Since they haven't seen the person's picture, when the man comes over, many have ulterior motives. This is what happens on the Dateline TV show, and one can only imagine how many other kids or teens are in similar situations without getting caught. Secondly, technology takes you away from your family and friends. Family members may feel that you love the computer more than them. Friends may invite you out, like to the mall or for a drink, but you might choose to check something online instead. Gradually, you will start to lose the people who are most important to you. My final reason is that technology takes you away from living your own life. Online, there is a lot of content that others claim is cool, but you should do what you think is cool. For instance, if someone posts that @NUM1 guys think London is amazing and you've always wanted to go to @LOCATION1, don't let others' opinions sway you. Also, spending too much time online means you don't get enough fresh air, and your skin can become pale and unhealthy. In conclusion, although some people may think that advanced technology is beneficial, it clearly has drawbacks. It exposes us to danger, separates us from friends and family, and prevents us from experiencing what life has to offer.

Do adults and kids spend too much time on the computer? I don't think so. Sure, they use it a lot, but it's mainly for entertainment. Kids need computers as an alternative way to communicate. Texting and phone calls cost money. If someone doesn't have texting, they can use platforms like Facebook to make plans with friends. On a rainy day when there's nothing else to do, the computer comes in handy. Computers are a great source of entertainment for kids. There are tons of games available on different websites. For example, there are MMORPGs and RPGs. They are like a virtual outside world for kids. Computers are also essential for school projects. They can be used to conduct research and find pictures. While books are useful, they don't always have all the information you need, and you can't cut pictures out of them. To get good grades on projects, kids need to use computers. In summary, computers are necessary for communication, entertainment, and school projects, so it's reasonable for adults and kids to use them.

I believe people should have computers at home. Computers are useful for important tasks such as job - hunting. One can also carry out work on a computer. It is a great tool for teaching children how to use technology and allowing them to search for kid - friendly content on the internet.  However, people should not spend all their time on computers. They should prioritize spending time with their families and friends. Many people use computers almost daily, which might worry their families. People can also use computers to teach their friends typing and share historical knowledge.  When having a visitor at home, one should not be overly absorbed in the computer, as it may give the wrong impression. Computers offer the opportunity to learn about distant places and gain knowledge from the internet. But not everyone agrees on unrestricted computer use, as people can get addicted. Some think it's a great idea to spend more time on computers than with family, while others believe the opposite. In conclusion, a balance should be struck between computer use and real - life social interactions.

Dear readers, in my opinion, excessive use of the computer has both positive and negative aspects. On one hand, computers can provide a wealth of information, offer various entertainment options, and facilitate communication. For example, we can access online courses to learn new skills, connect with friends and family around the world through social media, and work remotely. On the other hand, spending too much time on the computer can lead to health problems such as eye strain, back pain, and a sedentary lifestyle. It may also reduce face - to - face interactions and cause people to become isolated.  In conclusion, while computers are an important part of modern life, we should use them in moderation to enjoy their benefits without suffering from their drawbacks.

Dear Local Newspaper, I firmly hold the view that computers are beneficial for society. Without computers, numerous tasks would be impossible to accomplish. They often provide the easiest solution, which is why I am fond of them. Computers make almost anything achievable.  For instance, an elderly person with limited mobility can manage their bills, search for a job, or shop online using a computer. Even those who are just feeling lazy can lie in bed all day, work remotely, or order items from the mall. All they need to focus on is personal hygiene. Moreover, computers can relieve a great deal of stress. There are no annoying co - workers or angry bosses; everything can be just fine.  However, it is crucial to choose a good computer. An old one may break down, which is one of the drawbacks of computers. Although they can be a bit troublesome at times, once you get the hang of them, they are extremely useful. In conclusion, despite the minor issues, computers are highly beneficial, and one can do almost anything with them.
